summary: "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland," also known as "Alice in Wonderland," is a beloved children's book written by Lewis Carroll in 1865. The story follows Alice, who falls into a magical world filled with talking animals and strange creatures after chasing a rabbit. This fantasy adventure is famous for its silly and imaginative scenes. The book is illustrated by John Tenniel and has been translated into many languages. It's inspired lots of movies, plays, and even theme park rides, showing its enduring popularity with both kids and adults. Carroll also wrote a sequel, "Through the Looking-Glass."
title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
